sen.j: 青木 周藏（あおき しゅうぞう、1844年3月3日（天保15年1月15日 (旧暦)） - 1914年2月16日）は明治、大正期の外交官、政治家。
sen.e: Shuzo AOKI (March 3, 1844-February 16, 1924) is a diplomat and a statesman during Meiji and Taisho era.
Shuzo AOKI (March 3, 1844-February 16, 1914) was a diplomat and a statesman during the Meiji and Taisho era.
sen.cmt: 1924→1914,is→was と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: Shuzo AOKI (March 3, 1844-February 16, 1914) was a diplomat and a statesman during the Meiji and Taisho era.

sen.j: 勲等は勲一等。
sen.e: His medals for merit is the First Order of Merit.
His medal for merit was the First Order of Merit.
His medal for merit was the First Order of Merit.

sen.j: 爵位は子爵。
sen.e: His peerage is Viscount.
His peerage was viscount.
His peerage was viscount.

sen.j: 山口県厚狭郡生田村（現山陽小野田市）出身。
sen.e: He is from Ikuta-mura, Asa County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present Sanyo Onoda City).
He was from Ikuta-mura, Asa County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present Sanyo Onoda City).
He was from Ikuta-mura, Asa County, Yamaguchi Prefecture (present Sanyo Onoda City).

sen.j: 幼名は三浦團七。
sen.e: His childhood name was Sanpo Danshichi.
His childhood name was Danshichi SANPO.
sen.cmt: Sanpo Danshichi→Danshichi SANPO と修正しました。
sen.e: His childhood name was Danshichi SANPO.

sen.j: 長州藩の村医三浦玄明の長男として生まれた。
sen.e: He was born as the eldest son of Haruakira SANPO, a rural doctor in Choshu Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was born as the first son of Haruakira SANPO, a village doctor in the Choshu Domain.
sen.cmt: eldest→first,rural→village と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: He was born as the first son of Haruakira SANPO, a village doctor in the Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 22歳の時、明倫館好生堂（医学所）館長で後の宮廷大典医となる青木研蔵（1815-1870）の養子となって士族となった。
sen.e: At the age of 22, he was adopted by Kenzo AOKI who was the director of Meirinkan Koseido (a medical institute) and would later become the chief Imperial doctor, and Danshichi went into the shizoku (warrior class).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the age of 22, he was adopted by Kenzo AOKI (1815-1870) who was the director of Meirinkan Koseido (a medical institute) and later became the chief imperial doctor, and Danshichi became shizoku (warrior class).
sen.cmt: would later become→later became,Imperial→imperial,went into the→became と修正しました。 （1815-1870）を補いました。
sen.e: At the age of 22, he was adopted by Kenzo AOKI (1815-1870) who was the director of Meirinkan Koseido (a medical institute) and later became the chief imperial doctor, and Danshichi became shizoku (warrior class).

sen.j: 青木研蔵は、毛利敬親の侍医で日本で初めて種痘を行った蘭学者青木周弼（1803-1863）の弟であった。
sen.e: Kenzo AOKI was the younger brother of Shusuke AOKI who was the doctor to the Takachika MORI and conducted the vaccination for the first time in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kenzo AOKI was the younger brother of Shusuke AOKI (1803-1863), who was the court physician of the Takachika MORI and conducted the vaccination for the first time in Japan.
sen.cmt: （1803-1863） を補いました。doctor to→court physician of と修正しました。
sen.e: Kenzo AOKI was the younger brother of Shusuke AOKI (1803-1863), who was the court physician of the Takachika MORI and conducted the vaccination for the first time in Japan.

sen.j: この際に2人の名を取り周藏と改名した。
sen.e: When he was adopted, he changed his name to Shuzo after Kenzo and Shusuke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this occasion, he changed his name to Shuzo after the two, Kenzo and Shusuke.
sen.cmt: When he was adopted→In this occasion と修正しました。after the two, を補いました。
sen.e: In this occasion, he changed his name to Shuzo after the two, Kenzo and Shusuke.

sen.j: 明倫館で学んだ後、長崎での医学修行を経て、1868年藩留学生としてドイツ留学。
sen.e: After studying Meirinkan and learning medical science in Nagasaki, he went to Germany to study medical science as an overseas student of his domain in 1868.
After studying at Meirinkan, he learned medical science in Nagasaki, then went to Germany to study medical science as an overseas student of his domain in 1868.
sen.cmt: at を補いました。スペースを修正しました。細部適宜修正して流れをスムースにしました。
sen.e: After studying at Meirinkan, he learned medical science in Nagasaki, then went to Germany to study medical science as an overseas student of his domain in 1868.

sen.j: 渡独後、医学から政治、経済学に無断転科し問題となった。
sen.e: While he was in Germany, he changed his major from medical science to politics and economics without permission, which became a problem.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: While he was in Germany, he changed his major from medical science to politics and economics without permission, which became a problem.
While he was in Germany, he changed his major from medical science to politics and economics without permission, which became a problem.

sen.j: だが来独中の山縣有朋に談判して解決させた。
sen.e: But he settled the problem by having a direct talk with Aritomo YAMAGATA who was visiting Germany.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But he solved the problem by having a direct talk with Aritomo YAMAGATA who was visiting Germany at that time.
sen.cmt: settled→solved と修正しました。at that time を補いました。
sen.e: But he solved the problem by having a direct talk with Aritomo YAMAGATA who was visiting Germany at that time.

sen.j: 1872年、北ドイツ留学生総代となり在独留学生の専攻科目決定に介入し物議をかもす。
sen.e: In 1872 he became the representative of the overseas students in North Germany and aroused much controversy by intervening in deciding the major subjects of the students in Germany.
In 1872 he became the representative of the overseas students in North Germany and aroused much controversy by intervening in the decision of the major subjects of the students in Germany.
sen.cmt: deciding→the decision of と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1872 he became the representative of the overseas students in North Germany and aroused much controversy by intervening in the decision of the major subjects of the students in Germany.

sen.j: 当時の留学生の専攻は軍事、医学に集中していたためであった。
sen.e: This is because the major subjects of the overseas students centered in military and medical science.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is because the major subjects of the overseas students centered in military and medical science at the time.
This is because the major subjects of the overseas students centered in military and medical science at the time.

sen.j: 青木の真意は日本近代化には、専攻を分散することの必要を説くことだった。
sen.e: Aoki's true intention was to appeal the necessity of decentralizing the major subjects for the modernization of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Aoki's true intention was to appeal the necessity of decentralizing the major subjects for the modernization of Japan.
Aoki's true intention was to appeal the necessity of decentralizing the major subjects for the modernization of Japan.

sen.j: 青木の推奨もあって、林業、製紙、ビール、製絨（羅紗絨毯）などの分野へ特化して成功した人物も出た。
sen.e: With Aoki's recommendation, some people succeeded by specializing in the area of forest industry, paper manufacturing, beer brewing and manufacturing carpets (thick woolen carpets).
With Aoki's recommendation, some people succeeded by specializing in the areas of forest industry, paper manufacturing, beer brewing and manufacturing carpets (thick woolen carpets).
With Aoki's recommendation, some people succeeded by specializing in the areas of forest industry, paper manufacturing, beer brewing and manufacturing carpets (thick woolen carpets).

sen.j: 1873年外務省入省。
sen.e: He entered the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1873.
He entered the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1873.
He entered the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1873.

sen.j: 外務省1等書記官を経て翌年駐独公使。
sen.e: Through serving as the first secretary of Foreign Ministry, he became the Ambassador in Germany the next year.
Through serving as the first secretary of Foreign Ministry, he became the minister-counselor in Germany the following year.
Through serving as the first secretary of Foreign Ministry, he became the minister-counselor in Germany the following year.

sen.j: のち駐オーストリア、オランダ各公使を兼任。
sen.e: Later he doubled as the minister-counselor in Austria and Netherlands.
Later he doubled as the minister-counselor in Austria and Netherlands.
Later he doubled as the minister-counselor in Austria and Netherlands.

sen.j: 1886年第1次伊藤内閣の外務次官。
sen.e: In 1886 he became the vice minister of Ministry of Foreign Affairs in the First Ito Cabinet.
In 1886 he became the Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs in the first Ito cabinet.
sen.cmt: vice minister of Ministry of Foreign Affairs→Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs,First Ito Cabinet→first Ito cabinet と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1886 he became the Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs in the first Ito cabinet.

sen.j: 第1次山縣内閣・第1次松方内閣の外務大臣を務めた。
sen.e: He served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs in the First Yamagata and the First Matsukata Cabinet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs in the first Yamagata and the first Matsukata cabinet.
He served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs in the first Yamagata and the first Matsukata cabinet.

sen.j: 対英条約改正交渉を行い駐英公使として領事裁判権撤廃の条約改正に奮闘した。
sen.e: He was engaged in negotiations on revision of the treaty with the Britain to abolish the counselor jurisdiction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He made strenuous efforts to negotiate on the revision of the treaty with the Britain to abolish the counselor jurisdiction.
sen.cmt: was engaged→made strenuous efforts,in the negotiation→to negotiate と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: He made strenuous efforts to negotiate on the revision of the treaty with the Britain to abolish the counselor jurisdiction.

sen.j: 青木の条約改正案は従来のものと異なり治外法権に関して「対等合意」(外国人裁判官の大審院への不採用、外国人不動産は領事裁判権を撤廃しない限り認めないことを明記）を目指した。
sen.e: Aoki's plan to revise the treaty was, unlike the conventional ones at the time, to aim 'taito goi (agreement on equal basis), in which not adopting a foreign judges to the Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) and not admitting the possession of real estate by foreigners as long as the counselor jurisdiction was abolished were described.

Aoki's plan to revise the treaty was, unlike the conventional ones at the time, to aim 'taito goi' (agreement on equal basis), (not adopting foreign judges to the Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan), and not admitting the possession of real estate by foreigners unless the counselor jurisdiction was abolished were specified).
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。a foreign judges→foreign judges,as long as→unless,described→specified と修正しました。カッコを補い、適宜修正しました。
sen.e: Aoki's plan to revise the treaty was, unlike the conventional ones at the time, to aim 'taito goi' (agreement on equal basis), (not adopting foreign judges to the Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan), and not admitting the possession of real estate by foreigners unless the counselor jurisdiction was abolished were specified).

sen.j: 帝政ロシアが東アジアに進出することに不安を抱くイギリスが日本に好意を持つなど時勢にも恵まれ交渉は成功しかけた。
sen.e: Blessed with the conditions of the time including the Britain's favorable stance toward Japan due to the fear of Imperial Russia's advancement to the East Asia, the negotiations almost succeeded.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Blessed with the conditions of the time including the Britain's favorable stance toward Japan due to the anxiety of the Imperial Russia's advancement to the East Asia, the negotiations almost succeeded.
sen.cmt: fear→anxiety と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: Blessed with the conditions of the time including the Britain's favorable stance toward Japan due to the anxiety of the Imperial Russia's advancement to the East Asia, the negotiations almost succeeded.

sen.j: だが、新条約調印寸前で大津事件が発生し引責辞任、交渉は中断される。
sen.e: However, on the edge of the concluding the treaty the Otsu Incident happened and Aoki took responsibility by resigning, and the negotiations were halted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, on the edge of the concluding the treaty, the Otsu Incident happened and Aoki took responsibility by resigning, so the negotiations were halted.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。and→so と修正しました。
sen.e: However, on the edge of the concluding the treaty, the Otsu Incident happened and Aoki took responsibility by resigning, so the negotiations were halted.

sen.j: なお、この際ロシア公使に対して犯人津田三蔵の死刑を確約しながら、判決が無期懲役となり公使が抗議に訪れた。
sen.e: In addition, after the incident Russia's ministry-counselor visited Aoki and protested against the indefinite imprisonment of the culprit Sanzo TSUDA although his death penalty had been promised.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, the Russia's ministry-counselor visited Aoki after the incident and protested against the indefinite imprisonment of the culprit Sanzo TSUDA, although his death penalty had been promised.
sen.cmt: theを補い、オーダーを修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: In addition, the Russia's ministry-counselor visited Aoki after the incident and protested against the indefinite imprisonment of the culprit Sanzo TSUDA, although his death penalty had been promised.

sen.j: するとこれを伊藤博文と井上馨の指示だと述べたことによって両名の恨みを買う事になった。
sen.e: Aoki explained to the ministry-counselor that it was because he had been instructed to do so by Hirobumi ITO and Kaoru INOUE, which created their animosity toward him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Aoki explained to the ministry-counselor that it was because he had been instructed to do so by Hirobumi ITO and Kaoru INOUE, which created their animosity toward him.
Aoki explained to the ministry-counselor that it was because he had been instructed to do so by Hirobumi ITO and Kaoru INOUE, which created their animosity toward him.

sen.j: （相手国公使に対する通告内容に関する最終決定権は大臣である青木にある）
sen.e: (Aoki, who was the Minister, had the right to decide what content would be noticed finally to the minister-counselor of the counterpart nation.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (Aoki, who was the Minister, had the right to decide what content would be noticed finally to the minister-counselor of the counterpart nation.)
(Aoki, who was the Minister, had the right to decide what content would be noticed finally to the minister-counselor of the counterpart nation.)

sen.j: 1894年駐英公使として陸奥宗光外務大臣と条約改正に尽力、日英通商航海条約改正に成功。
sen.e: Aoki was committed to revising the treaty as a minister-counselor in Britain with Foreign Minister Munemitsu MUTSU, and succeeded in revising the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation.

Aoki was committed to revising the treaty as the minister-counselor in Britain with the Foreign Minister Munemitsu MUTSU, and succeeded in revising the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation in 1894.
sen.cmt: 「1894年」を補いました。a→the と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: Aoki was committed to revising the treaty as the minister-counselor in Britain with the Foreign Minister Munemitsu MUTSU, and succeeded in revising the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation in 1894.

sen.j: また第2次山縣内閣外務大臣として北清事変に対処、列強の動きを敏感に察知し積極的な介入を試みた。
sen.e: In addition Aoki dealt with Hokushin (North China) Incident and tried to intervene aggressively in the incident, detecting the movement of the powerful countries.

In addition Aoki dealt with Hokushin (North China) Incident as the Minister for Foreign Affairs of the Second Yamagata Cabinet, and tried to intervene aggressively in the incident, detecting the movement of the powerful countries.
sen.cmt: 「第2次山縣内閣外務大臣として」を補いました。
sen.e: In addition Aoki dealt with Hokushin (North China) Incident as the Minister for Foreign Affairs of the Second Yamagata Cabinet, and tried to intervene aggressively in the incident, detecting the movement of the powerful countries.

sen.j: 枢密顧問官を経て叙勲され子爵。
sen.e: After serving as a privy counselor, he was promoted to a viscount.
After serving as a privy counselor, he was conferred the title of viscount.
sen.cmt: promoted to a viscount→conferred the title of viscount と修正しました。
sen.e: After serving as a privy counselor, he was conferred the title of viscount.

sen.j: 1906年には駐米大使として移民問題の解決につとめる。
sen.e: In 1906 he was engaged in solving the immigration problem as the Japanese Ambassador in the United States.
In 1906 he was engaged in solving the immigration problem as the Japanese Ambassador to the United States.
In 1906 he was engaged in solving the immigration problem as the Japanese Ambassador to the United States.

sen.j: 外交官としての青木の半生は条約改正交渉に長く深く関わった。
sen.e: Aoki was deeply involved for a long time in negotiations of revision of treaties during his half a life.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Aoki was deeply involved for a long time in the negotiations of revision of treaties, as a diplomat during half his life.
sen.cmt: 「外交官としての」を補いました。the を補いました。his half a life→half his life と修正しました。
sen.e: Aoki was deeply involved for a long time in the negotiations of revision of treaties, as a diplomat during half his life.

sen.j: 外交政略としては早くから強硬な討露主義と朝鮮半島進出を主張した。
sen.e: As for diplomatic measures he strongly insisted on beating Russia and advancement to Korean Peninsular from the beginning.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As for diplomatic measures he strongly insisted on beating Russia and advancement to Korean Peninsular from the beginning.
As for diplomatic measures he strongly insisted on beating Russia and advancement to Korean Peninsular from the beginning.

sen.j: 日露戦争後は大陸への進出を推進した。
sen.e: After Russo-Japanese War, he promoted Japan's advancement to the Chinese continent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Russo-Japanese War, he promoted Japan's advancement to the Chinese continent.
After the Russo-Japanese War, he promoted Japan's advancement to the Chinese continent.

sen.j: 留学生、公使として滞独生活は25年に及んだ。
sen.e: He spent as long as 25 years in Germany as a overseas student and a minister-counselor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He spent as long as 25 years in Germany, as an overseas student and a minister-counselor.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。a→an と修正しました。
sen.e: He spent as long as 25 years in Germany, as an overseas student and a minister-counselor.

sen.j: 日本におけるドイツ通の第一人者としてドイツの政治体制、文化の導入をはかった。
sen.e: He promoted introducing German political system and culture as the most well-versed expert on Germany.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He promoted introducing the German political system and culture as the most well-versed expert on Germany in Japan.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。「日本における」を補いました。
sen.e: He promoted introducing the German political system and culture as the most well-versed expert on Germany in Japan.

sen.j: 甲武鉄道会社社長三浦泰輔は実弟。
sen.e: Taisuke SANPO, the president of Kobu Railway Company, is his own younger brother.
Taisuke SANPO, the president of Kobu Railway Company, was his own younger brother.
Taisuke SANPO, the president of Kobu Railway Company, was his own younger brother.

sen.j: 養子の青木梅三郎は杉孫七郎（皇太后宮大夫等を歴任）の息子。
sen.e: The adopted child Umesaburo AOKI is a son of Magoshichiro SUGI (who held various posts including kotaigo gu no daibu (Master of the Empress Dowager's Household)).
The adopted child Umesaburo AOKI was a son of Magoshichiro SUGI (who held various posts including kotaigo gu no daibu [Master of the Empress Dowager's Household]).

sen.e: The adopted child Umesaburo AOKI was a son of Magoshichiro SUGI (who held various posts including kotaigo gu no daibu [Master of the Empress Dowager's Household]).

sen.j: ペルー日本大使公邸占拠事件時の特命全権大使青木盛久は曾孫。
sen.e: Morihisa AOKI who was the Japanese Ambassador in Peru at the time of the Japanese embassy hostage crisis is Shuzo's great-grandchild.
Morihisa AOKI, who was the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary at the time of the Japanese embassy hostage crisis in Peru is Shuzo's great-grandchild.
